data.title: Basic Condition System for the Map Editor
data.body:
Hey, 
the idea is to give the mapers, who are affraid of coding and Lua scripting, some basic editor tool to click-create simple logic conditions for maps.  

Like selecting some pre arranged condition from a dropdown menu.
for example:
- If "atMissionStart" then "give cash" "2500" to "player1". 

Sure, that tool will never be as mighty as scripting directrly with lua. This shall not replace something here. It's more about filling the gabs. 
I'm aware that my suggestion is rly amazing complex and it has to grow slowly to cover all the basic needs (Timers, Counters,.), but it would significantly lower the entry barrier to "maps with logic".
In my opinion it would be nice to see an average mapper being able to create maps with logic.
It also could boost the recreation of the singleplayer campaigns for example. 
Think about it, why aren't they done yet? A big problem is that only a few mapers understand the basics of Lua scripting. The singleplayer campaigns are the ideal testcase for such a map tool.

You can imagine that logic tool like that of SC1. Watch a bit of this here and you should understand what I'm talking about: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kDx4CWotPKA

data.title: Railway tracks don't render properly in the map editor
data.body: Both in the sidebar and on the map.  This is probably related to depth metadata.

data.title: Spies are OP
data.body:
TLDR:

Spies are OP, I think there needs to be some discussion around how best to nerf them

Spies can be so hard to spot, I was playing a game earlier with a player I suspect was Christian, (Drunk) SoScared and Kazu, as well as two other players, but this also applies in a 1v1. Kazu sent about 20 spies into Christian's base, Christian was being attacked from two fronts and had 45 APM in an hour long game, so he didn't notice, he then continually sent spies into Christian's power plants, low power is such a set-back, also, this was an FFA on a large map, so Christian was floating around 30k, had Kazu sent the spies into the refinery he could have literally stolen the entirety of Christian's cash with a single click, it seems fair that a player can be punished for floating so much cash, but all players were floating in this game, and such severe punishment seems unjust.

When you're concentrating on micro managing your units spotting a spy can be so difficult, this applies to a game of any size, whether team or 1v1 IMO.

There is also the possibility of "spy locking", chrono over an MCV, put a spy on hold at 1 second with 6 barracks, then build the 7th at your enemys base and spy the power, refinery, or pretty much anything you like, this is practically impossible to stop, because once you are in low power, or 30k has been reduced to 3,750 by 3 spies, you can't build any units to counter. I have watched this happen on several occasions, and experienced it myself on at least one memorable occasion on Sidestep, I had control of `literally every expansion`, I had a 15+ APM lead on the player I was playing against (and I don't waste actions) and a spy lock lost me the game.

data.title: Defeated players in an FFA can pause the game
data.body: As with #12226, I'm not sure whether this applies exclusively to defeated players or whether specs can do this too, but earlier I lost in an FFA and accidentally paused the game. It seems wrong that a player that can no longer interact with the gameplay can pause the game.

data.title: Make dead players specs in an FFA
data.body:
I'm not sure whether this is exclusive to FFAs or whether it's just when there are no specs in a game, but when players are defeated in an FFA they can only use global chat, spectator chat is not available.

I'm not sure whether this is by design for some reason, but it seems like a reasonable change IMHO.

data.title: Change spy-tag
data.body:
noticed that the lettering of the "fake buildings" actually fit also on Infantry ... so i suggest we use a tag that actually is readable instead of the "eye?" 
this would actually fit very well , since buildings aswell as infantry can actually be fake ... so the lettering would make it consistent 

![spytag](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/19400107/f5a375ea-9254-11e6-9808-c07164b5eee5.png)

data.title: Map Editor: Some Ideas
data.body:
I think with this features we could make the map editor more useable for map creators.
Here's @TheRaffy's and my wishlist:
- [ ] Add a window for the map's yaml (with save button) #2438
- [ ] If not created, create a button that adds it automatically (but when the lua is empty, delete it again)
- [ ] Add a window for the map's lua (if created, with save button)
  - [ ] Add a small window of Information about the current unit you are hovering over
  - [ ] Change owner
  - [ ] Change name
  - [ ] Change health #10818
- [ ] Save & play the map directly from editor
  - [ ]   Add the actors Number/Name to the Information window (ingame, f.e. `Actor107`).
- [ ] Copy a piece of a map and paste it on another map

data.title: NOD missions build 3 sam sites
data.body: A lot of the NOD missions have a secondary objective 'build 3 SAMs to fend off the GDI bombers' though when you build them it doesn't stop the bombers.  From what I remember from the original game  they would just try shoot them down.  Since they can't be shot down could it just have a trigger to stop them altogether once you build 3?

data.title: Make sure AI can deploy an MCV when it lacks a base.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Fixes #12159.

The `RestrictMCVDeploymentFallbackToBase` flag restricts AI to deploying new MCVs near to the existing conyard (and is true by default). However, if there is no conyard then it obviously cannot find any suitable locations!

The fix is to allow the MCV to deploy anywhere if there is no conyard it can be built near to.

data.title: [RA & TD] Vision range of Chinook helicopter husks.
data.body:
The Chinook helicopter used to have a vision range of 12 cells, but this has since been reduced to 10 cells. However its husk still has 12 cells of vision, so it actually has better vision upon getting shot down which doesn't make sense. This should be changed to 10 cells.
In TD the opposite is true, the Chinook has a vision range of 10 cells, while its husk has 8 cells of vision.

[RA]
TRAN:
+RevealsShroud:
++Range: 10c0

TRAN.Husk:
+RevealsShroud:
++Range: 12c0

[TD]
TRAN:
+RevealsShroud:
++Range: 10c0

TRAN.Husk:
+RevealsShroud:
++Range: 8c0

data.title: MsBuild: Post: Fix binaries (LargeAddressAware)
data.body:
Add editbin.exe as Postbuild event to make binaries able to use more than 2GB on Windows

```
....
_CopyAppConfigFile:
  Die Datei wird von "App.config" in "..\OpenRA.Test.dll.config" kopiert.
CopyFilesToOutputDirectory:
  Die Datei wird von "obj\x86\Debug\OpenRA.Test.dll" in "..\OpenRA.Test.dll" kopiert.
  OpenRA.Test -> D:\Projekte\OpenRA\OpenRA.Test.dll
  Die Datei wird von "obj\x86\Debug\OpenRA.Test.pdb" in "..\OpenRA.Test.pdb" kopiert.
PostBuildEvent:
  IF  EXIST  "%VS140COMNTOOLS%"  CALL  "%VS140COMNTOOLS%vsvars32.bat"
  IF  EXIST  "%VS120COMNTOOLS%"  CALL  "%VS120COMNTOOLS%vsvars32.bat"
  IF  EXIST  "%VS110COMNTOOLS%"  CALL  "%VS110COMNTOOLS%vsvars32.bat"
  IF  EXIST  "%VS100COMNTOOLS%"  CALL  "%VS100COMNTOOLS%vsvars32.bat"
  editbin.exe /LARGEADDRESSAWARE "D:\Projekte\OpenRA\OpenRA.Test.dll"
  Microsoft (R) COFF/PE Editor Version 14.00.24213.1

Die Erstellung des Projekts "D:\Projekte\OpenRA\OpenRA.Test\OpenRA.Test.csproj" ist abgeschlossen, Rebuild Ziel(e).

Build succeeded.
D:\Projekte\OpenRA [msbuild-postbuild-laa ≡]>

data.title: Crash in multiplayer while paused
data.body:
Version: Playtest 20161001
Exception of type 'System.OutOfMemoryException' was thrown.

I have 32GB of RAM.

This issue has been problematic for a while but OpenRA normally only crashes after many hours of being paused.

We play our own maps with are normally large 
![openra-2016-10-11t101310272z](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22424535/19279683/4784420e-8fda-11e6-90a2-5ea6409470c8.png)
(typically 256x256) with carefully tweaked rules.  Our games often run on for several hours by design.

We started a "2 player with bots" MP game last night and left it paused all night without any issues (paused by client player).  I played a bit this morning before work and paused it again (paused by server player).  When I got back from work I found it had crashed after less than an hour of being paused.

Thanks to all the good work this is now the only crash bug we are seeing.

Server and client logs attached.  I have a replay and custom map available but it crashes 2 hours into the game and after severable long pauses,

I checked the Windows Event Viewer on both computers and could not find anything obvious.
[Logs.zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/522419/Logs.zip)
[Logs_Client.zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/522418/Logs_Client.zip)

Not sure if this is helpful.

data.title: D2K - Text notifications
data.body:
In original D2K there are some red text notifications appear on same place as chat and mission messages(we should go with Mission messages' place on OpenRA, on top.). AFAIK there are only 4, "Airstrike Ready", "Fremen Ready", "Saboteur Ready" and "One of our buildings has been captured"(not sure about exact wording). 

I would prefer having voice notifications but as we don't have sounds for them going with the way that original game would be good.

data.title: FixHeader.exe: Add Platform detection support
data.body:
This allows Fixheader.exe to do thing on the specified platform:
- CorHeader on Mono (Unix & OSX)
- LargeAddressAware flag (Windows)
- prevent crash when on missing arguments
  closes #12207
  closes #12125
- But Keep in Mind you have to run it against all DLLs and Exe files

data.title: FixHeader.exe: Enable support for Windows, Linux and OSX
data.body:
Recently we added support for "more than 2GB AddressSpace " but fixheader.exe will patch the Binary in Windows with the MonoHeaders so it could be brocken when patching them we should add a check for Windows and Linux & OSX 
- Do stuff needed only for Windows (For Example LAA)
- Do stuff nneded only for Linux/OSX (CorHeader)

data.title: Limit the amount of engineers built by the AIs
data.body:
From http://www.openra.net/#comment-2943347335:

> Please remove the enigneers from the AIs again. The AI now wastes a lot of money sending engineers to death for no reason. The AI just isn't smart enough to use this unit.
> Playing against AIs became much easier because of this.

data.title: Ubuntu: Force move (Alt + right click) only works with "Lock mouse to window"
data.body:
Mint 18 Xfce 64bit, live session.

Without the "lock mouse to window" the command seems to get totally ignored (no green line move indicator when clicked)

Also it seems that the force move isn't documented anywhere... in wiki or input hotkey settings.

data.title: Game crashes on window unfocus Ubuntu 15.04/16.04
data.body:
### Description

I get pretty persistent game crashes when the window loses focus, sometimes the Window can lose focus without issue, it seems to occur most frequently (if not exclusively) when focus is lost whilst interacting with the game, for example if I accidentally hit the volume key or Windows key whilst trying to micro.

When it happens killing the process with `sudo kill -9` doesn't close the game window, it just kills the music, I can still open the window and see the frozen game, however the cursor doesn't change as normal and I can't interact with it at all. The only way to get rid of the dead window is to reboot.

<details>
<summary>

Click to expand logs</summary>


### exception.log

```
Date: 2016-09-12 20:45:39Z
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 5.1.2600.196608 Service Pack 3)
Runtime Version: Mono 2.11.4 (tarball) CLR 4.0.30319.17020
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Failed to initialize platform-integration library. Check graphics.log for details.
  at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
```
### graphics.log

```

  at (wrapper managed-to-native) SDL2.SDL:SDL_Init (uint)
  at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.Sdl2GraphicsDevice..ctor (Size windowSize, WindowMode windowMode) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.DefaultPlatform.CreateGraphics (Size size, WindowMode windowMode) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Renderer..ctor (IPlatform platform, OpenRA.GraphicSettings graphicSettings) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
System.DllNotFoundException: SDL2.dll
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) SDL2.SDL:SDL_Init (uint)
  at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.Sdl2GraphicsDevice..ctor (Size windowSize, WindowMode windowMode) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.DefaultPlatform.CreateGraphics (Size size, WindowMode windowMode) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Renderer..ctor (IPlatform platform, OpenRA.GraphicSettings graphicSettings) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
```
### IRC log

```

[02:49] <AMHOL> I can't alt-tab at all, have reported in the past but still no luck
[02:49] <+pchote> I don't think anyone knows how to start the game crashes on Ubuntu
[02:49] <+pchote> you'll need to give some details

[02:49] <AMHOL> Well if I accidentally hit the volume key
[02:49] <AMHOL> Or the windows key or alt-tab
[02:49] <AMHOL> And the window loses focus
[02:49] <AMHOL> The game freezes
[02:49] <+pchote> that sounds like a driver / window manager related thing

[02:50] <+pchote> and what version are you on?
[02:50] <+pchote> if you're on release, then test the playtest
[02:50] <AMHOL> Pseudo-fullscreen
[02:51] <AMHOL> It happens in the playtest too
[02:51] <AMHOL> Tried upgrading mono
[02:51] <+pchote> try switching to Fullscreen

data.title: [RA] Units attack building under capture by engineer
data.body: I don't know where you guys will find this on the micro/macro spectrum, but I'm sick and tired of having to sequester units defending an engineer away from the building he's capturing. Was there any logic in the original game to stave off the attack of nearby units to a building that's currently under capture by an (allied) engineer? If I start a building capture, but my invading force is too strong, I lose out on the ability to take buildings pretty quickly. At least if they don't automatically become aggressive against buildings that are already in capture progress, the game's macro makes sense.... obviously different if I choose to attack the building with direct orders.

data.title: D2k arrakis.yaml tilesets mixed up
data.body:
Bug description and Fix suggestion.

In an attempt to use OpenRA.Utilities.exe to import mission A1V1 i noticed some misplaced tiles.
Using the correct tileset for this map `BLOXTREE.R8` (phrase "BLOXTREE" found in a original D2k .Sav file of the mission) only some of the misplaced tiles were correct now.

I compared in the map editor with original game "screenshots" and found:
Rock-Detail 94 should be Rotten-Base 251
Rotten Base 250 and 251 together should be Sand-Detail 117

In `arrakis.yaml` (tileset file of d2k) i found the corresponding entries under `ID:94, ID:250, ID:251`
Replacing`Images: BLOXBASE.R8` with `Images: BLOXTREE.R8` fixed the issue. The map is now displayed correctly with no manual edit.
![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16046997/19252391/e443b52a-8f44-11e6-9cf0-de329f1d24f3.png)

Is this the right way to do it? I guess one could find the correct frames of  `ID:94 ID:250 ID:251` as an alternative way to fix it.
Maybe someone with insight to the underlying mechanics can deduce a general fix for all tiles/tilesets?

One thing i noticed after the fix: the tiles like       

```
Tiles:
            0: Sand
```

show up in wrong color in the map preview. i think the tiletype would have to be corrected as well...

Cheers,
    SirCake

data.title: Chinook Transports are unable to remain airborne over open terrain. [Playtest_20161001]
data.body:
With the removal of "attackmove:" from  the Chinook, it has lost its ability to remain airborne over open terrain.  I think having the ability to remain airborne without hovering over trees/water/debris is a desirable feature.

This affects both TD & RA Chinooks.
